intro: Clerodendrum tessmannii, commonly known as the African flame bush, is a shrub native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from red to orange. The plant produces small, round berries that are typically orange or red when mature. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and requires well-drained soil. Clerodendrum tessmannii is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
